revised_title: Diurnal Flight Performance and Predation Risk in Small Birds
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Ecology and Behavior
tldr: This study investigates the diurnal variation in flight performance and predation risk in small birds, specifically zebra finches. The research shows that birds are slower and less agile at dusk than at dawn, making them more vulnerable to predation. This finding supports recent models of optimal daily trajectories of body mass in small birds.
